articles.title: Kim Jong Il Greets Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Greets Syrian President 
Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Saturday sent a message of greetings to Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the independence of Syria.
					 The message reads as follows:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations to you and the friendly government and people of Syria on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of independence, the auspicious national holiday of your people.
					
					 After the independence the Syrian people registered a great success in the struggle to protect the sovereignty of the country and the nation and build modern Syria under the correct leadership of the Baath Arab Socialist Party.
					
					 Our people extend full support to you and the Syrian people in the just cause for the peace, stability, development and prosperity of the country and impartial and comprehensive settlement of the Mideast issue.
					
					 I, availing myself of this opportunity, express belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between our two countries will grow stronger, sincerely wishing you good health and happiness and greater success in your responsible work for the country and people.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Syrian President 
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the independence of Syria.
					The message wished the President and people of Syria greater success in their efforts to retake the occupied Golan Heights and achieve a fair and comprehensive settlement of the Mideast issue and the development and modernization of the country.

articles.title: WPK Sends Greetings to CPC 6th Congress
articles.content:
WPK Sends Greetings to CPC 6th Congress 
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Saturday sent a message of greetings to the 6th Congress of the Communist Party of Cuba.
					 The message expressed belief that the congress would mark an important occasion in the struggle of the party and people of Cuba to strengthen the party and advance the cause of socialism as required by the present situation and the developing reality.
					
					 The C.C., the WPK, extends full support and firm solidarity to the struggle of the CPC and Cuban people to firmly defend the gains of the revolution won at the cost of blood and achieve prosperity of the country by frustrating the vicious U.S. sanctions and blockade, it noted.
					
					 Expressing belief that the militant friendship and traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and peoples forged in the joint struggle for independence against the imperialism and for socialism would grow stronger, the message wished the congress great success.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Censured for Derailing Tour of Mt. Kumgang
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Censured for Derailing Tour of Mt. Kumgang 
						
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee declared the stand that it would terminate the validity of the provision of the agreement on tour of Mt. Kumgang signed with the Hyundai side, which calls for granting it monopoly over the tour, and the DPRK would take charge of the international tour through the areas of the north side.
					 However, the south Korean authorities call for repeal of this stand for no ground, asserting that it is "unacceptable" as "violation of the agreement".
					
					 In this regard the DPRK General Guidance Bureau for the Development of Scenic Spots issued a detailed report on Saturday to explain why this step was taken and condemn the south Korean authorities for creating the present crisis.
					
					 The report cited detailed facts to prove that the south Korean authorities are chiefly to blame for derailed tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					According to it, the tour started in November 1998 after the DPRK accepted the request of the Hyundai Group.
					
					 But the separatist forces of south Korea, who were displeased with the tour at its very start, had made desperate efforts to block it.
					
					 In 1989 the then military dictatorial regime of south Korea trampled down the protocol on the tour of Mt. Kumgang, which was signed between the KAPPC and the Hyundai Group for the first time, delaying the tour for several years.
					
					 It became possible to open the way for the tour after the change of the regime in south Korea in 1998. But the group of the "Grand National Party", reduced to an opposition party, stood against the tour, claiming that the cost of tour could be used "exclusively for military purposes".
					
					 The south Korean conservative authorities unilaterally declared the suspension of the tour immediately after the occurrence of the tourist accident in July 2008.
					
					 In October last year and January this year the DPRK side repeatedly proposed working contact for resuming the tour of Mt. Kumgang but the south Korean authorities refused to respond to this proposal.
					
					 They persistently barred the Hyundai side from even meeting with the DPRK side, thus making it impossible to hold contact between the business parties for the tour.
					
					 Moreover, they raised the nuclear issue and the cases of warship sinking and Yonphyong Island shelling as preconditions for the resumption of the tour th
					
					accepted the request of the Hyundai Group.
					
					 But the separatist forces of south Korea, who were displeased with the tour at its very start, had made desperate efforts to block it.
					
					 In 1989 the then military dictatorial regime of south Korea trampled down the protocol on the tour of Mt. Kumgang, which was signed between the KAPPC and the Hyundai Group for the first time, delaying the tour for several years.
					
					 It became possible to open the way for the tour after the change of the regime in south Korea in 1998. But the group of the "Grand National Party", reduced to an opposition party, stood against the tour, claiming that the cost of tour could be used "exclusively for military purposes".
					
					 The south Korean conservative authorities unilaterally declared the suspension of the tour immediately after the occurrence of the tourist accident in July 2008.
					
					 In October last year and January this year the DPRK side repeatedly proposed working contact for resuming the tour of Mt. Kumgang but the south Korean authorities refused to respond to this proposal.
					
					 They persistently barred the Hyundai side from even meeting with the DPRK side, thus making it impossible to hold contact between the business parties for the tour.
					
					 Moreover, they raised the nuclear issue and the cases of warship sinking and Yonphyong Island shelling as preconditions for the resumption of the tour th
					
					accepted the request of the Hyundai Group.
					
					 But the separatist forces of south Korea, who were displeased with the tour at its very start, had made desperate efforts to block it.
					
					 In 1989 the then military dictatorial regime of south Korea trampled down the protocol on the tour of Mt. Kumgang, which was signed between the KAPPC and the Hyundai Group for the first time, delaying the tour for several years.
					
					 It became possible to open the way for the tour after the change of the regime in south Korea in 1998. But the group of the "Grand National Party", reduced to an opposition party, stood against
					
					They can never evade the blame for having broken the agreement on tour of Mt. Kumgang with any sophism and trick.

articles.title: Coordinator of National Coordinating Committee of WPM Leaves
articles.content:
Coordinator of National Coordinating Committee of WPM Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, left here for home on Saturday after his visit to the DPRK to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Malaysian Party Delegation Concludes DPRK Visit
articles.content:
Malaysian Party Delegation Concludes DPRK Visit
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia led by Dato Haji Tajuddin Bin Abdul Rahman, member of its Supreme Council, left here for home Saturday.
					 The delegation visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, and the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Party Founding Memorial Tower, the International Friendship Exhibition House, the Three-Revolution Exhibition, etc., staying in the DPRK.

articles.title: Friendly Gathering Held
articles.content:
Friendly Gathering Held 
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A friendly gathering with the delegations and delegates of organizations for the study of the Juche idea from different countries and regions was held on Saturday.
					 Present there were Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council, the delegations and delegates of organizations for the study of the Juche idea from different countries and regions and Kim Chang Ryong, vice-chairman of the Social Scientists Society of Korea, and its members.
					
					 They talked about the need to boost the study and dissemination of the Juche idea.
					
					 They had diverse sports and amusement games and sang songs, deepening the friendship.

articles.title: Moscow Classical Ballet in Pyongyang Festival
articles.content:
Moscow Classical Ballet in Pyongyang Festival
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Many art troupes from different countries are taking part in the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival, which is going on in Pyongyang. Among them is the Moscow Classical Ballet of Russia.
					 The ballet is a world famous art troupe which has produced many talented danseurs and danseuses, including 17 international concours winners. It, formed in Juche 55 (1966), has made performance tours in some 200 cities of Russia and over 30 countries.
					
					 It is the first time for the troupe to participate in the Pyongyang festival.
					
					 The troupe performs "Dance of Russia" from the ballet drama "Swan Lake" and other pieces it prepared with sincerity to contribute to the festival held in praise of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The performance was enthusiastically acclaimed by the audience.

articles.title: German Artistes Enjoy Popularity in Pyongyang Festival
articles.content:
German Artistes Enjoy Popularity in Pyongyang Festival
						
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Among the participants in the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival in Pyongyang are German artistes from the Creusen Concert Association.
					 They are cellist Alexander Omar Suleiman and pianist Patricia Anne Hoy. Both of them are international concours winners. 
					
					 They perform famous music pieces like "Le Grand Tango" to win a big hand.
					
					 In the performance at the Moranbong Theatre on April 13, they received some encores.
					
					 After the performance they told KCNA they were satisfied with Korean people's warm welcome.
					
					 They said they are participating in the festival for the first time, out of the desire to witness the specific situation of Korea. 
					
					 "In Korea, we have come to know many things," they said.
					
					 Art troupes taking part in the festival are on a high level and the State Symphony Orchestra of Korea is excellent, they added.

articles.title: Central Meeting of Koreans in Japan Held
articles.content:
Central Meeting of Koreans in Japan Held
						
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A central meeting of Koreans in Japan took place at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Friday to commemorate the 99th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Attending it were Chief Vice-Chairman Ho Jong Man and vice-chairmen of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Ho in his report at the meeting said that thanks to the wise leadership of the President, who saved the movement of Koreans in Japan from crisis and performed great feats for the strengthening and development of Chongryon, the Koreans in Japan could fully enjoy the honor and pride of being overseas citizens of the DPRK in Japan where racial maltreatment and discrimination are rampant.
					
					Like the President who performed great feats for the strengthening and development of the movement of Koreans in Japan, General Secretary Kim Jong Il has shown warm care for Chongryon and Koreans in Japan, the reporter said, adding:
					
					He sent the relief fund of 500,000 U.S. dollars to the Korean residents in Japan who suffered great damage from the recent killer quake and ensuing tsunami. This gave strength and courage to the organizations of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan so that they could turn out in the drive to heal the damage and stabilize the living of the sufferers at an early date.
					
					 The reporter called on all the Chongryon officials and compatriots to more vigorously conduct the patriotic movement with firm confidence in victory of the cause of Juche started by Kim Il Sung and being carried forward by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A letter of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Events Held by Chongryon to Commemorate Day of Sun
articles.content:
Events Held by Chongryon to Commemorate Day of Sun
						
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- The Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) arranged a lecture meeting at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Friday to commemorate the 99th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there were Chief Vice-Chairman Ho Jong Man and vice-chairmen of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, deputies to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, advisors to the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, the permanent advisor to the Research Institute on History of Korean Residents in Japan, directors of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, senior officials of leading organizations and businesses, chairmen of the Chongryon headquarters in Kanto and other officials and compatriots.
					
					 The participants watched video lecture "Our Eternal Father".
					
					 That day a photo exhibition was also held by the Chongryon Central Standing Committee on the same occasion.

articles.title: Foreign Newspapers Commemorate Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Foreign Newspapers Commemorate Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries carried special write-ups with pictures of smiling President Kim Il Sung to commemorate his birth anniversary.
					 The Russian newspaper Nakhodkinski Rabochi in an article titled "Kim Il Sung, Eternal President" on April 5 stressed that he is the founder of socialist Korea.
					
					His idea and cause have been steadily carried forward, the paper said, adding that General Secretary Kim Jong Il has developed in depth the Juche idea, the Songun idea founded by the President as required by the new era and embodied it in all-round way.
					
					 The Mexican newspaper Unidad Nacional on March 31 elaborated on the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung in the cause of building the party and the state, saying that the Korean people hold him in high esteem as the eternal President of the DPRK.
					
					 Kim Jong Il successfully accomplished the cause of perpetuating the memory of the President, the paper said, adding: The revolutionary history of the President continues without letup in the reality of the DPRK where his wishes and behests are being successfully carried into practice by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A newspaper of Romania on April 6 carried an article titled "The 99th Birth Anniversary of President Kim Il Sung". The article cited facts to note that the President wisely led the arduous anti-Japanese armed struggle and the building of a new country after Korea's liberation, the Fatherland Liberation War, the postwar rehabilitation and socialist construction and enforced popular policies in the DPRK.

articles.title: Bulletins Issued Abroad to Mark Important Days of DPRK
articles.content:
Bulletins Issued Abroad to Mark Important Days of DPRK
						
Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Bulletins were issued by an international body and in different countries on April 3 and 7 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 The Women's International Democratic Federation carried in its bulletin an article titled "The Sun Is Everlasting". The article noted that Kim Il Sung founded the immortal Juche idea to usher in the era of independence, a new era in the history of humankind. It elaborated on the fact that many organizations were formed on a worldwide scale to study and disseminate the Juche idea.
					
					 The Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea and the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association in their joint bulletin noted with high appreciation that the President led the revolution and construction to victory by believing in the people's strength and relying on it. The bulletin told about the source of the inexhaustible strength of the KPA.
					
					 The Brazil-Korea Friendship Association in its bulletin stressed that the KPA has been built up into an army strong in idea and faith under the guidance of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Observed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Indonesia, Iran, Myanmar, Malaysia, Thailand, South Africa and Nigeria between April 4 and 9.
					They were to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 On display in the exhibition venues were photos on the exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Korean films shown included "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Reply of Korea".
					
					 The chairman of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia said that Kim Il Sung was the genuine leader of people who devoted all his life to the prosperity of the country and the people's happiness.
					
					 Under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, who is identical to the President, the Korean people will surely build a prosperous and powerful paradise of the people in Korea, the chairman stressed.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated Abroad
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries between April 5 and 9 to commemorate the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included lectures in Guinea, Uganda, Zimbabwe and Italy, round-table talks in Pakistan and Sweden and a lecture and a reading session in Guinea.
					
					On display in the venues of lectures were works of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos showing their exploits.
					
					 The director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea said that Kim Il Sung had performed noteworthy exploits in the history of human thought.
					
					 The President was the great leader of the cause of global independence, the director general said, adding: He had rendered sincere assistance to the national independence and independent development of many countries and energetically worked for the strengthening and development of the socialist movement and the non-aligned movement.
					
					 Kim Il Sung is the founder of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea demonstrating its dignity as a politico-ideological, military and scientific and technological power, the acting executive secretary of the Ugandan National Women's Council said, adding:
					
					 His idea and cause have been steadily carried forward by Kim Jong Il. The reality of the DPRK evidently proves that the revolutionary history of the President continues without letup.
					
					 The chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Songun Idea in Fermo of Italy described the whole life of the President as a history of legendary great man who saved and defended the destiny of the country and the nation.
					
					 The secretary general of the Punjab Provincial Committee of the National Workers' Party of Pakistan and the secretary general of the Lahore Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association stressed that the cause of Kim Il Sung would surely be accomplished by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chairman of the Communist Party in Sweden and the chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway praised Kim Il Sung as the great revolutionary who devoted all his life to the sacred cause of prosperity and happiness of the country and the people and global independence.
					
					 The chairman of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association of Guinea said that Kimilsungia, flower of the sun, is coming into full bloom all over the world with boundless reverence of all people for the President.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the lecture in Guinea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Ecuador
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Ecuador
						
Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Our Socialism Centered on the Masses Shall Not Perish" was brought out in e-book by Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People on April 7.
					 The work, published on May 5, Juche 80 (1991), clarifies the inevitability of the victory of socialism, the secret of solidity and invincibility of Korean-style socialism, its essential character, etc.

articles.title: Day of Sun Observed in Ukraine
articles.content:
Day of Sun Observed in Ukraine
						
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A Ukrainian national seminar on the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung took place at the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine on April 2 to commemorate the Day of the Sun, his birth anniversary.
					 Nikolai Polishk, chairman of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, made a report under the subject of "Great Man in the Century".
					
					 Kim Il Sung founded the Juche idea to open the new era of independence, the reporter said, adding that though more than 80 years have passed since the birth of this idea its historic significance and vitality are growing stronger as the days go by.
					
					 Ashurski, a member of the Association for the Study of Songun Politics in Mariupol City of Ukraine, said in his speech titled "Great Brilliant Commander" referred to the fact that the President led to victory the two revolutionary wars against the U.S. and Japanese imperialists. He is gifted strategist and iron-willed brilliant commander, the speaker stressed.
					
					 Konstantin Doroshenko, chairman of the "Sun of Juche" Association of Journalists and Men of Culture for the Study of Kimjongilism in Ukraine, in his speech titled "Person Who Led the Social Revolution of Two Phases to Victory" praised the exploits the President performed by wisely leading the anti-imperialist, anti-feudal democratic revolution after Korea's liberation and the postwar socialist revolution.
					
					A message to General Secretary Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Meetings of Conveying Relief Fund Go On in Japan
articles.content:
Meetings of Conveying Relief Fund Go On in Japan
Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held at Ibaraki Korean Primary and Senior High School and Fukushima Korean Primary and Middle School in Japan on April 10 and 11 to convey the relief fund sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il to Korean residents who suffered from the killer quake and ensuing tsunami.
					 Present at the meetings were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), the chairmen and officials of the Ibaraki and Fukushima prefectural headquarters of Chongryon, disaster-stricken compatriots, staff and students of the schools and parents of students.
					
					 Nam made delivery speeches at the meetings.
					
					 Officials of Chongryon and compatriots should overcome the present trials by displaying the indomitable will and the spirit of mutual support and assistance, cherishing the warm love of Kim Jong Il, he said.
					
					 He stressed the need to rehabilitate and normalize the compatriots' life and business activities of commercial workers as early as possible and dynamically advance the patriotic movement of Chongryon.
					
					 Then the relief fund was conveyed to the disaster-hit Korean residents.
					
					 Speakers expressed gratitude to Kim Jong Il who sent precious relief fund with worry about disaster-afflicted compatriots in Japan.
					
					 Letters to Kim Jong Il were read out at the meetings.

articles.title: Quake Hits New Zealand
articles.content:
Quake Hits New Zealand
						
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- An earthquake with magnitude-5 occurred in Kermadec Islands of New Zealand on April 11.
					 Its epicenter was in the water area near the islands.

articles.title: Russia Is Ready to Produce High-performance Satellites: Putin
articles.content:
Russia Is Ready to Produce High-performance Satellites: Putin 
 Moscow, April 14 (KCNA) -- Russia's space industry is able to produce high-performance satellites, Prime Minister Vladimir Putin said at a recent meeting on the prospect of development of astronautics.
					 Russia needs quality space vehicles of new generation with serviceable life, he said, adding that if radical change is not made in this field, launch of new space vehicles would not result in big significance.
					
					 The Russian space industry is able to carry out this strategic task, he said, stressing the need to update the enterprises and increase investment in science and designing.

articles.title: Russia to Establish Moscow Antiaircraft Defense System
articles.content:
Russia to Establish Moscow Antiaircraft Defense System
						
Moscow, April 14 (KCNA) -- Russia plans to establish Moscow antiaircraft defense system by 
					S-400 air defence systems in about 2016.
					 The plan helps defend Moscow from air attack, said the commander of the Aerospace Defense Operation Strategic Command of Russia recently.

articles.title: China Attaches Importance to Handling Cases by Discipline Inspection, Prosecution Organs
articles.content:
China Attaches Importance to Handling Cases by Discipline Inspection, Prosecution Organs
 Beijing, April 14 (KCNA) -- He Yong, member of Central Committee Secretariat of the Communist Party of China and deputy secretary of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the CPC, at a recent roundtable talks held in Beijing on investigation into and disposal of cases by discipline inspection and prosecution organs across the country called for the quality and level of this work.
					 Party committees and governments of different levels should intensify leadership and support to this work and those organs should sincerely perform their responsibilities and establish a responsible system, he said.

articles.title: Palestinians Urge US to Take Clear Position on Mideast Peace
articles.content:
Palestinians Urge US to Take Clear Position on Mideast Peace
						
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Palestinian National Authority on April 13 condemned the U.S. attitude toward the issue of Mideast peace.
					 America's position regarding Jewish settlement constructions in the occupied Palestinian territories should be more resolute, he said.
					
					 He added that Washington should resume its efforts on the bases that the borders of the future Palestinian statehood include the land that Israel has occupied in 1967 with East Jerusalem as the Palestinian capital.

articles.title: Vietnam Slams US "Human Rights Report"
articles.content:
Vietnam Slams US "Human Rights Report"
						
Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Vietnamese Foreign Ministry recently rejected the U.S. "report" on Vietnamese human rights situation.
					 The report is very improper as its allegations are based on the facts contrary to the Vietnamese situation, he charged.
					
					 The Vietnamese government is ensuring the people's rights and freedom in politics, economy, culture and all other fields, he said, adding that this reality has been recognized by the international community.

articles.title: Meeting of African Ministers of Public Health Held
articles.content:
Meeting of African Ministers of Public Health Held 
						
 Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A meeting of ministers of Public Health of Africa was recently held in Brazzaville of Congo.
					 Discussed at the meeting were issues of strengthening state system of public health, training many medical workers and providing medical supplies in African countries.
					
					 At the end of the meeting, the "Brazzaville Declaration on Non-infectious Diseases" was adopted as a part of action plan to cope with many diseases. 
					
					 Information and technical exchanges and hygienic propaganda for prevention of diseases in those countries will take place in accordance with it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia la función artística de Unidad 10215 del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia la función artística de Unidad 10215 del EPC
Pyongyang, 16 de abril (ATCC) -- Con motivo del Día del Sol (15 de abril, cumpleaños del  Presidente Kim Il Sung), el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejército Popular de Corea, presenció la función del grupo de propaganda artística de la Unidad 10215 del EPC.
					 Le acompañaron en esta ocasión los cuadros directivos del partido y el ejército: Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Choe Thae Bok, Hong Sok Hyong, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk y Kim Chang Sop, los oficiales y soldados del EPC y los funcionarios de las ramas de literatura y arte, prensa e información.
					
					Se presentaron en la escena el cuarteto mixto y coro "Canción de felicidad", la recitación de poesía "Líder y el 15 de abril", el solo femenino "Nuestro líder inolvidable", la flauta y coro femenino "El partido es el regazo del General", la canción acompañada de guitarra y solo femenino "Por la única Patria", el entremés "El problema de impresión", el solo de guitarra baja "Corre el tren de reunificación", la narración poética "Nuestra línea de vida", el coro "Pino verde en el monte Nam" y otras piezas de diferentes géneros.
					
					Los ejecutantes cantaron en tono patético la gran dignidad nacional y orgullo del pueblo coreano, que tiene de generación en generación la fortuna de contar con excelentes líderes y generales, y el poderío invencible del heroico EPC formado como pelotón suicida para la defensa del líder en el regazo del General Insigne del monte Paektu.
					
					Igualmente, demostraron bien la férrea convicción y voluntad de los militares del EPC de defender a costa de la vida las conquistas de  la revolución preparadas por el Presidente Kim Il Sung bajo la dirección veterana y probada del PTC. 
					
					A través de la función en que desbordaron el entusiasmo revolucionario y el ímpetu combativo, ellos dieron pruebas de la gran capacidad de los artistas militares que cumplen magníficamente su sagrada misión de trompeteros de la era del Songun infundiendo en el corazón de los militares el gran amor por el partido, el líder, la patria y el pueblo.
					
					Muy satisfecho de que los miembros del grupo de propaganda artística de la citada unidad hayan ofrecido esta función de manera fresca y combativa con excelentes obras de gran valor cognoscitivo y educativo que reflejan la inagotable potencia espiritual de los militares del EPC, el Dirigente evaluó altamente los éxitos logrados en la ocasión y les expresó agradecimiento.
					
					El Dirigente presentó las tareas programáticas que servirán de guía en intensificar la propaganda artística de carácter revolucionario y combativo, señalando que ella resulta muy importante en la educación ideológica de los militares.
					
					Subrayó que es muy elevado el entusiasmo de lucha de los militares y civiles de Corea que avanzan a todo galope hacia la gran potencia invencible con su gran propósito.
					
					Expresó la esperanza y convicción de que todo el partido, todo el ejército y todo el pueblo acogerán el centenario de nacimiento del Presidente como la máxima fiesta de la nación de Kim Il Sung y la histórica de la humanidad, al registrar grandes innovaciones y saltos en todos los sectores mediante la ofensiva general para llevar a la realidad el deseo del Presidente de construir una gran potencia próspera.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envía mensaje de felicitación a Bashar al-Assad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envía mensaje de felicitación a Bashar al-Assad
Pyongyang, 16 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envió el día 16 un mensaje de felicitación al Presidente de la República Árabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad, con motivo del aniversario 65º de la independencia de este país.
					El texto sigue abajo:
					
					Envío a Vd. y al amistoso gobierno y pueblo de la República Árabe de Siria mis cálidas felicitaciones en ocasión del 65º aniversario de la independencia de Siria, jubilosa fiesta nacional de su pueblo.
					
					Después de la independencia, el pueblo sirio logró grandes éxitos en la lucha por defender la soberanía del país y la nación y construir una Siria moderna bajo la acertada dirección del BAAS.
					
					Nuestro pueblo apoya totalmente la justa causa de Vd. y el pueblo sirio para lograr la paz, la estabilidad, el desarrollo y la prosperidad del país y resolver de modo imparcial y comprensivo el problema del Medio Oriente.
					
					Convencido de que las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperación entre nuestros dos países se fortalecerán y se desarrollarán más, aprovecho esta oportunidad para desearle de todo corazón buena salud, felicidad y mayores éxitos en su trabajo responsable para el país y el pueblo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reúne con huéspedes extranjeros
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reúne con huéspedes extranjeros
						
Pyongyang, 16 de abril (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, departió la víspera en un ambiente amistoso en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con los huéspedes extranjeros participantes en la reunión consultiva de funcionarios directivos del comité internacional para el centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					En la ocasión estuvieron presentes los copresidentes del referido comité: Hibrahim Mantu, ex vicepresidente del Senado de la Asamblea Nacional de Nigeria y su comitiva, Yousef Al Amiri, presidente de la Asociación de Amistad Kuwait-Corea, y su comitiva y Anders Kristensen, presidente de la Asociación de Amistad Dinamarca-RPDC; y los secretarios del citado comité: Martin Lotscher, presidente del Comité Suiza-Corea, Zabed Ansari, secretario general de la Sucursal de Karachi de la Asociación de Amistad Pakistán-Corea, Reymond Ferguson, vicepresidente del comité preparatorio regional de Asia-Pacífico y secretario nacional de la Asociación de Amistad y Cultura Australia-RPDC, C. P. Mainali, secretario general del Comité Central del Partido Comunista Nepalés (Marxista-Leninista) y presidente del comité preparatorio nacional de Nepal, Sumiko Shimizu, representante del Consejo de Mujeres Japonesas para la Solidaridad con las Mujeres Coreanas y presidenta del comité preparatorio de Japón y Alejandro Cao De Benos, presidente de la Asociación de Amistad con Corea con sede en España y del comité preparatorio de esta entidad.
					
					En la audiencia, Hibrahim Mantu señaló que realizará ingentes esfuerzos por conmemorar con solemnidad el centenario de natalicio del Presidente como gran festival internacional.
					
					Y expresó su convicción de que bajo la sabia dirección de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il, el pueblo coreano logrará éxitos en la lucha por construir la gran potencia próspera y reunificar el país.

articles.title: DDILF culpa al Sur de Corea de quiebra del acuerdo de turismo
articles.content:
DDILF culpa al Sur de Corea de quiebra del acuerdo de turismo
						
Pyongyang, 16 de abril (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el Comité Coreano por la Paz de Asia y el Pacífico (CCPAP) de la República Popular Democrática de Corea declaró que invalidará el artículo sobre el monopolio concedido a la parte de Hyundai en el acuerdo del turismo al monte Kumgang, firmado con ese grupo surcoreano, y administrará el turismo internacional al mismo lugar por vía del territorio norcoreano.
					Al respecto, las autoridades surcoreanas reclaman absurdamente la "cancelación" de lo anunciado por el CCPAP hablando cínicamente de la supuesta "violación del acuerdo" y "medida inaceptable".
					
					La Dirección de Desarrollo Integral de Lugares Famosos de la RPDC publicó el día 16 una información detallada para explicar las circunstancias, que obligaron a tomar esa medida, y denunciar a las autoridades surcoreanas que crearon la situación tan crítica de hoy.
					
					Hay de sobra los datos reveladores de que las autoridades surcoreanas son culpables de la suspensión del turismo al monte Kumgang, señala la información y prosigue:
					
					Esa labor turística comenzó a partir de noviembre de 1998 a instancia del Grupo Hyundai del Sur de Corea.
					
					Disgustadas desde el principio del turismo al monte Kumgang, las fuerzas anti-reunificación del Sur de Corea actuaron siniestramente para frustrarlo.
					
					En 1989 cuando se ha firmado por primera vez el protocolo entre el CCPAP y la parte de Hyundai sobre el mismo tema, el "poder" de dictadura militar del Sur de Corea lo convirtió en letra muerta y dilató así por varios años el inicio del turismo.
					
					Después del cambio del "poder" en 1998, se abrió por fin la ruta del turismo al monte Kumgang.
					
					Los compinches del "Gran Partido Nacional", que era entonces un partido opositor, se opusieron rotundamente alegando que "el Norte gastará los ingresos del turismo en fines militares".
					
					Luego de tomar el poder, las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas proclamaron unilateralmente el cese del turismo tan pronto como estallara el incidente de turista surcoreana en julio de 2008.
					
					Ellas ni siquiera han respondido a las propuestas de la RPDC hechas en octubre del año pasado y en enero de este año para sostener el contacto de trabajo sobre la reanudación del turismo al monte Kumgang.
					
					Impidieron hasta el encuentro entre los hombres de Hyundai con nuestros funcionarios correspondientes.
					
					Pusieron condiciones injustas a la reanudación del turismo tales como problema nuclear y los incidentes de hundimiento de la corbeta "cheonan" y de cañonazos en la isla Yonphyong, que no tienen nada que ver con el turismo.
					
					Para colmo, obstruyeron el trabajo de las agencias de viaje extranjeras, que recogían a los aspirantes a visitar el monte Kumgang, acusándolas de "violar los derechos de trabajo". 
					
					Ellas abortaron el turismo al monte Kumgang no para la seguridad personal de los turistas sino partiendo de su complot anti-RPDC y sus metas de enfrentamiento con ésta. 
					
					El hecho de, que ellas suspendieron unilateralmente el turismo al monte Kumgang y malemplearon este tema en los fines de confrontación fratricida entre ambas partes coreanas, constituye evidentemente un acto ilegal que violó el acuerdo entre los socios de turismo y las autoridades del Norte y el Sur.
					
					Convirtieron esa labor turística en un aparato de su siniestra campaña conflictiva anti-RPDC chismeando que ella significa la "entrega desmesurada" y la "fuente de ingresos" para la RPDC.
					
					Resulta un acto muy cínico y descarado que quienes hablan de la violación del acuerdo entre las autoridades N-S son precisamente las autoridades surcoreanas que violaron flagrantemente las declaraciones conjuntas N-S.
					
					Tomar las medidas del turismo internacional al monte Kumgang es el ejercicio legítimo de la soberanía de la RPDC.
					
					Puesto que debido a tal proceder de las autoridades surcoreanas, se ha paralizado casi 3 años el turismo al monte Kumgang y ni siquiera existen las posibilidades de reiniciarlo, la RPDC no podrá estar con brazos cruzados viendo que eso afecta su dignidad y soberanía.
					
					La reciente medida de la RPDC es el proyecto más racional y realista para remediar el paro largo del turismo y satisfacer el deseo de los nacionales y extranjeros de visitar el monte Kumgang.
					
					Además, toma en consideración hasta los intereses de Hyundai y otras firmas surcoreanas que sufrieron muchas pérdidas por la paralización del turismo.
					
					Al bloquear a la población surcoreana la ruta de turismo al monte Kumgang e intentar de frustrar hasta el proyecto de turismo internacional de la RPDC, las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas demostraron por sí solas que son malvados maníacos de confrontación fratricida.
					
					Ellas no podrán eludir con ningún sofisma e intriga la responsabilidad por la quiebra del acuerdo sobre el turismo al monte Kumgang.

articles.title: Artistas alemanes sobresalen en el 27º FAAAP
articles.content:
Artistas alemanes sobresalen en el 27º FAAAP
						
Pyongyang, 16 de abril (ATCC) -- Entre los participantes en el XXVII Festival Artístico de Amistad Abril en Primavera, que transcurre con éxito en esta capital, figuran los artistas alemanes del "Concierto de Creusen".
					  Especialmente, el violonchelista Alexander Omar Suleiman (de 41 años de edad) y la pianista Patricia Anne Hoy (de 52 años de edad) son ganadores de concurso internacional.
					
					  Ellos dejaron profundamente impresionados a los espectadores reproduciendo en vibraciones de sus instrumentos musicales las melodías suaves y peculiares de canciones famosas del mundo, como el dúo de violonchelo y piano "Le Grand Tango".
					
					  En la función del día 13 ofrecida en el Teatro Moranbong, ellos tuvieron que repetir la interpretación a petición del público.
					
					  En entrevista con la ATCC, dijeron estar complacidos por la cálida bienvenida del pueblo coreano y prosiguieron:
					
					  Participamos por primera vez en este festival con el deseo de ser testigo presencial de la realidad de Corea.
					
					  Tuvimos muchas novedades durante nuestra estancia en Corea.
					
					  Tienen alto nivel los conjuntos artísticos participantes en el 27º FAAAP, en particular, la Orquesta Sinfónica Nacional de Corea es comparable con una banda sinfónica de primera categoría del mundo.
